key_insight: Large language models implicitly contain many internal sub-policies distributed across the Transformer residual stream and layers; by decomposing the model bottom-up, you can identify and optimize these internal policies separately for more targeted and interpretable policy improvement.
problem_solved: Standard RL treats an LLM as a single unified policy, which hides layer/module-level decision structure and leads to coarse, inefficient, and opaque policy updates; this work exposes and leverages internal policies for finer-grained optimization.
method: Decompose the global policy by exploiting the intrinsic split of the Transformer residual stream and the equivalence of composing hidden states to isolate layer/module-level internal policies.
Reconstruct per-layer/module policy components and measure their contributions to token-action choices.
Apply a bottom-up optimization procedure: optimize lower-level internal policies first, then propagate improvements upward to produce targeted global policy updates.
impact: Provides practitioners a pathway to more sample-efficient, interpretable, and modular policy optimization for LLMs—enabling targeted fine-tuning, safer interventions, and clearer reasoning diagnostics without treating the model as an indivisible black box.
visual_elements: Layered Transformer diagram with the residual stream split highlighted and small 'internal policy' icons at each layer
Bottom-up optimization flowchart showing isolate → optimize (low layers) → integrate → evaluate
Layer contribution heatmap (layers vs. token/action importance) to show where decisions originate
Before/after performance or alignment chart demonstrating targeted gains from internal-policy optimization
paper_title: Bottom-up Policy Optimization: Your Language Model Policy Secretly Contains Internal Policies
paper_authors: Yuqiao Tan, Minzheng Wang, Shizhu He, Huanxuan Liao, Chengfeng Zhao
